intro: Chenopodium purpurascens var. punctulatum, commonly known as the spotted goosefoot, is a flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate, ovate to triangular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The leaves typically display a reddish-purple coloration, especially on the underside, and the plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It is native to the western United States and is often found in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides or in dry, open areas. The species is sometimes cultivated as a forage plant or used in traditional herbal medicine.
